questions.question: Which of the following best describes your organisation?
Within your organisation, which of the following best describes your team role?
Which of the following best describes the industry sector of the organisation?
Which of the following best describes the type of agency you work for?
Approximately how big is the organisation globally, in terms of number of employees?
In which of the following regions does the organisation have employees based?
And in which country are you personally based?
If the organisation is international, are you answering on behalf of the region or globally?

Do you give your permission for the data you submit in this questionnaire to contribute to an overall benchmark dataset.  This will only involve the aggregate findings from the M3 questionnaire from multiple responses  - detail of your specific answers will not be shared

questions.actionText: More frequent evaluation of earned and editorial media channels
questions.question: Earned and editorial media channels

questions.actionText: More frequent evaluation of owned social media channels
questions.question: Owned social media channels

questions.question: Owned digital channels and web domains

questions.actionText: Measure the quality as well quantity of media coverage (eg sentiment, prominence or message delivery)
questions.question: Measure the quality of coverage (such as sentiment, prominence or message delivery)

Total impressions

questions.question: Identify and track topics and themes
questions.strengthText: We identify and track topics and themes on social media

questions.question: Adjust our strategy and execution based on evaluation reporting

questions.question: Use measurement and evaluation to provide insight for planning

questions.strengthText: There is a culture of accountability across the organisation

questions.actionText: Ensure that teams have buy-in to performance metrics which they are expected to achieve
questions.question: All teams within the organisation sign up to performance metrics which they are expected to achieve
questions.strengthText: Teams have buy-in to performance metrics which they are expected to achieve

questions.strengthText: Multiple metrics across the organisation are linked together to get a 'whole picture' view of performance

questions.strengthText: A range of tools and analysis techniques are used to assess performance

sections.sectionText:
To begin with, we would like to ask a few questions about your organisation so that we can classify the results. This will enable us to explore the data in more depth, comparing different groups and types of organisation.  

The data will be used to contribute to an overall data set that will allow you and other organisations to benchmark themselves.  Please note that other users will only be able to see the aggregate findings from this data set and will not be exposed to your specific answers.  No individual or organisation will be identified in any analysis.

If you are an agency and are answering on behalf of a client then please answer the following questions from the perpective of that client
How often do you measure and evaluate across the following … ?
When you measure and evaluate paid, earned, shared and owned media activity, how often do you report on the following?
Now, thinking about how communications is leveraged within you or your client's organisation, how often do you do the following … ?
How do you use PR and communications measurement and evaluation?
sections.sectionName: Use of PR and communications measurement and evaluation

sections.sectionText: How do you measure and evaluate changes in audience awareness, perception and engagement?
How do you approach understanding how activity drives organisation outcomes such as sales or other audience behaviour?
Thinking about your whole organisation - all the teams e.g. communications/ sales/ marketing/ operational etc. - how well do the following statements describe the culture of your organisation.
Thinking about the more advanced tools and techniques that your organisation might use, which if any, are you aware of?
With increasing advances in technology and analytics services, how well do you think your organisation is prepared to adopt new techniques of performance evaluation?
